section_title.title:
8 Steps to Join our
Mentorship Program and Level Up
section_title.subtitle: Make it #VetsWhoCode

items.title: Determine Your Role
items.description: Decide whether you want to join as a mentor or a mentee. Mentorship is open to veterans who would have qualified as a troop. Mentors should be within 2 years of experience relative to their mentee.

items.title: Complete the Mentorship Program Interest Form
items.description: Submit the application form to indicate your interest in participating. This is required for both mentors and mentees. Ensure your GitHub profile is included if you're applying as a mentee.

items.title: Initial Profile Review
items.description: We review the GitHub portfolio for mentees to gauge current skill level. This helps ensure appropriate matching and mentorship impact.

items.title: Interview with the VWC Team
items.description: All applicants—both mentors and mentees—will be interviewed. We assess alignment with our goals and values, and verify your readiness to participate effectively.

items.title: Confirm Eligibility
items.description: For mentees: Must be a veteran eligible to be a troop, not currently employed in a full-time developer role. Paid apprenticeships may still qualify. For mentors: Must be within two years of relevant experience compared to mentees.

items.title: Skill Level Self-Assessment
items.description: During the form submission or interview, you will be asked to self-assess your skill level. This ensures accurate pairing between mentors and mentees.

items.title: Mentor/Mentee Matching
items.description: Once reviewed and accepted, you'll be matched based on skill level, experience gap (no more than 2 years), and learning goals. Final approval will follow this stage.

items.title: Begin Your Mentorship Journey
items.description: After approval and matching, your mentorship officially begins. Expect regular check-ins, progress tracking, and support from the VWC community.
